author: DonaldBlake
title: #44 El momento en el que buques del ejército sionista bombardearon hace unos minutos el campo de refugiados de Mawasi, mientras los niños palestinos jugaban en la arena
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#1](c1#c-1) totalmente de acuerdo, pero me parece igual escoría los que negativizan el meneo ¿creen que tumbando la noticia esto no ha pasado? Se retratan a sí mismos
[#9](c9#c-9) La verdad es que hay que estar hecho de un tipo especial de excremento para votar "cansina" o "spam" las noticias sobre un genocidio. Porque "sensacionalista" haciendo un esfuerzo te lo compro si crees que el titular exagera. Pero lo otro no tiene nombre.
[#9](c9#c-9) Tan fácil como mandarlos al ignore a todos y cada uno de de ellos. Tengo tanto ojo que a casi todos ya los tenía en la cole.
[#9](c9#c-9) Hace un tiempo sacaron una extensión para twitter que te ocultaba los twits de todos las cuentas que interaccionan con cuentas de ultra derecha. Habría que hacer lo mismo aquí.
tarde o temprano los empezaran a cazar como las ratas que son por todo el mundo, e intentaran dar pena y todo, estos asesinos de mierda
[#4](c4#c-4) Habría que coger a cada soldado israelí y a cada mando del gobierno y pegarles fuego. No hay otra manera, a los nazis se los extermino, estos son iguales, deberían pasarles lo mismo
[#6](c6#c-6) No amigo,a los nazis no se les exterminó. Simplemente cambiaron de collar y para muestra un botón.
Los mismos que salvaban nazis y les ponían a currar con ellos -como por ejemplo mandar cohetes a la luna- ahora ayudan y mandan armamento a los sionistas.
Por cierto, el chiquillo que va corriendo por la playa y al que coge un adulto tiene una pinta de terrorista que no puede con ella...
[#27](c27#c-27)
Tu comentario es muy manipulador. Y lo sabes.
La Red Gladio fue creada por la OTAN. Cuéntalo todo.
Y esa red, formada por excombatientes nazis y fascistas italianos, perpetró atentados terroristas muy sangrientos, en Italia y otros lugares.
[#31](c31#c-31) https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alsos_Ruso
Antes de venir con Gladios y entrar al trapo cual toro, lee el enlace de la wiki y disfruta.
[#36](c36#c-36)
Lee lo siguiente y no trates de desviar la atención:
https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operaci%C3%B3n_Gladio
Parece un vídeo de ovnis de Iker.
En el vídeo no se ve nada de bombardeo.
Una columna de humo y se oye/ se quiere entender un helicóptero disparando a lo que parece ser una lancha.
¡ lo siento no veo más !
La miseria hiumana del ejército SSionista de Israel sería hoy aún mayor si no fuera porque hace tiempo que no lo puede ser más
Putos niños, ¿qué hacen divirtiéndose? Ver a un palestino feliz debe ser muy doloroso para cualquier sionista de bien,
[#10](c10#c-10) en la fuente hay un video, un video que vale mas que mil palabras de la porqueria que escriben en ElPais, ElMundo, CNN, NewYorkTimes y demas medios sionistas
[#10](c10#c-10) por mucho que los simpatizantes de los genocidas neguéis todo, no vais a conseguir que el mundo no lo vea.
[#10](c10#c-10) Pero que vergüenza dais defendiendo a los mataniños. Llevan meses asesinando inocentes y de los famosos terroristas ni flores. Como estrategia solo se entiende si tu objetivo es matar civiles. El terrorismo se combate con contraterrorismo y política, no lanzando bombas sobre familias enteras.

author: Irish Independent Newsdesk
title: Northern Lights seen across parts of Ireland again last night – but why is the visual treat occurring so often lately?
text:
Home > Irish News Northern Lights seen across parts of Ireland again last night – but why is the visual treat occurring so often lately? The sun nearing the peak of its solar cycle means we’ve seen more space weather events in recent months, according to forecasters
Northern Lights put on stunning display across Ireland and UK - 10th October 2024
Irish Independent Newsdesk Today at 07:45
The northern lights were visible in parts of the country on Thursday night with hues of pink, green and purple visible to the naked eye.
Social media users have shared photos of the Aurora Borealis across Ireland, as sightings of the lights were predicted in Scotland and Northern Ireland earlier by the UK’s Met Office.
The lights were also visible in southern counties Cork, Clare and Wexford.
Academic Jim Wild (49), who researches the aurora and space weather at Lancaster University in England, said: “My research focuses on the physics of the connections between the Sun and the Earth.
“Over the years, I’ve been to the Arctic Circle several times to make measurements of the aurora, but it’s really special to see the northern lights from your back garden with your whole family.”
Relatively clear skies were forecast for much of Ireland and the UK last night, creating a “decent chance of visibility”.
Kilworth Camp, Co.Cork. Photo: @auroraalertsIRE
A spokesman for Met Office UK said there had been “more space weather events in recent months”, including the Northern Lights, because the sun was nearing the peak of its solar cycle.
Met Office spokesman Stephen Dixon said there was a chance of some visible auroras across parts of the UK on Thursday night and into the early hours of Friday.
The auroras on Earth, which are most commonly seen over high polar latitudes but can spread south, are chiefly influenced by geomagnetic storms which originate from activity on the Sun.
The sun works on a cycle of around 11 years called the solar cycle – with peak sunspot activity on the surface of the Sun referred to as solar maximum.
Sunspots give the potential for Earth-directed releases of large bursts of energy, called coronal mass ejections, which can lead to aurora visibility.
Aurora displays occur when charged particles collide with gases in the Earth’s atmosphere around the magnetic poles.
As they collide, light is emitted at various wavelengths, creating colourful displays in the sky.

author: Mike Miletich
title: Illinois law ensures compensation for child social media influencers | Top Stories | wandtv.com
text: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (WAND) — If you pick up your phone or tablet and watch videos on TikTok or YouTube, you will likely see many video blogs or "vlogs" featuring families with young children. A new [Illinois law](https://ilga.gov/legislation/publicacts/103/PDF/103-0556.pdf) will ensure young social media influencers are paid for their work in videos with their parents or guardians. Children under 16 will be entitled to a share of the revenue from videos if they are featured in at least 30% of a vlogger's content each month. Parents or guardians will be required to set up a trust fund so minors can access the money when they are older. "This is a bill that was brought to me by a young 15-year-old high school student from Normal, Illinois. Her name is Shreya Nallamothu," said Sen. Dave Koehler (D-Peoria). "She was concerned about the risks of children being used in vlogging on the internet, especially where it is monetized and large sums of money were being created by their families in doing that." Minors will gain access to the money once they turn 18 or become legally independent from their parents or guardians. The law gained strong bipartisan support in the House and Senate this spring. Child influencers will be able to seek a private right of action against their parents if they were not properly compensated. Illinois will be the first state in the country to have this type of protection when the law takes effect Monday. "The one thing I would suggest for the future is that this bill does not go far enough," said Sen. Sue Rezin (R-Morris). "We need to look at social media and the impacts on minors in general, and I look forward to working on that topic in the future." Koehler and Rep. Sharon Chung (D-Bloomington) agreed this law is an important first step to address social media for kids. Senate Bill 1782 passed unanimously out of the Senate on May 19. The legislation passed out of the House on a 98-17 vote on May 16. Some House Republicans said they opposed the plan as they feel government should not impede on family relationships. "This bill is modeled after child actor labor laws and protects minors by having their parents or guardians set up a trust fund so that the minor can access these funds when they are older," Chung said. Copyright 2023. WAND TV. All rights reserved.
